body:
I'd really welcome this trait in OpenRA, however...

I don't think the tag is right. InfiltrateForUpgrade suggests me that the trait implements the upgrade logic while it does not.

Logic dictates it should be named InfiltrateForPrerequisite instead.
While I can foresee others would find the test-case inappropriate due to #7469, RA2 had 4 stolentech infantry, and it's reimplementation will need such a logic sooner or later.

I can't do a proper review now, but the e1 test case seems wrong to me.
While this is surprisingly clear code-wise, the resulting YAML (when done for 10-15-20-50 actors) would be terrible.
I want to ask reviewers (and yourself) to consider using our upgrade system.
You infiltrate a building, which grants a global upgrade, the appropriate upgrades on the units get triggered (and afaik `GainsExperience` already works with upgrades). Removes the need of defining a second actor.
I'd say keep the code changes, but abandon the testcase and any upgrade-based infiltration implementation should be separated to another PR.
My point here is there might be a better way to implement this. Also going this way would force mods to do some terrible things on YAML level.

Which I agree with. However the InfiltrateForSupportPower-->InfiltrateForActor rename should still happen, because until this PR, I never thought about using that trait for unlocking new units via infiltration - especially due to the fact that InfiltrateForSupportPower has no trait documentation at all, see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#infiltrateforsupportpower

There are situations when this logic comes handy, but the testcase is clearly not among them.

I'm not sure I'm following @penev92 - a global upgrade should get granted and upgrades on appropriate units should get triggered? You mean on existing units? Because the idea here is that the upgrade only applies to newly produced units, as in RA2. The existing units are left untouched...

@matija-hustic , @penev92 has a valid point that your current implementation is flawed due to the modder has to duplicate all affected units to trigger the initial promotion.

If I think about it, maybe the best way to get this effect is to make that InitialExperience trait of yours an Upgradable trait, and upgrade that via the actor gained. This does not give the veterancy mark upon the cameo, true, but a lot less cumbersome for mod maintenance.

A couple of thoughts:
- `InfiltrateForSupportPower` would be better renamed to `InfiltrateForProxyActor` than `InfiltrateForActor` -- unless somebody wants to massively increase the scope of that trait (which I don't recommend) so that it can spawn regular actors.
- You avoid duplicating actors by having it trigger an upgrade on the production structure, and having the production structure pass an `ExperienceInit` to the actors that it produces.  You then don't need to modify anything on the unit or its traits.

@pchote, I've just remembered that RA2 goes even further than the production queue. Any paradrops, units left after building destruction and crate-spawned units need to be upgraded as well (if RA2 behavior is to be replicated). This in particular means that the upgrades should take place at actor creation, not when adding to world (right now paradropped units are not in the world until they land - probably should also be changed for RA2).

My questions - how much sense does it make to use global upgrades seeing how
1) they are applied when adding to world at the earliest (can be ignored if paradrop will be modified),
2) prerequisites for each such upgrade need to be checked only once on creation and never again, as opposed to other global updates that need continuous checking?

And, should a new trait be better suited, should it
1) check prerequisites on creation (INotifyCreated) using the owning player's tech three (HasPrerequisites) and
2a) call upgrade manager to grant upgrades definable in the YAML file
or
2b) call GainsExperience.GiveLevels or GainsExperience.GiveExperience with a certain amount of input from YAMLs?

@Phrohdoh, when I look at the code, right now it seems that the paradropped actors are only added to world once they land (line 78 of Parachute.cs). Plus, they aren't attacked by enemies until they land. RA2 makes it possible to shoot at helpless parachuting units.

Went ahead and done some stuff while waiting for feedback :)

1) I haven't used global upgrades because they are applied only while adding to world, and usually after other traits are notified of adding to world.
2) I haven't implemented levelup through GainsStatUpgrades since this leaves out the rank effect.
3) Making GainsExperience implement UpgradableTrait isn't a perfect solution since silent levelup is sometimes needed, but not always.
4) Implementing icon change through the upgrade system would be more complex than the through the production queue. I am not sure which would be preferred tho.

I have two issues with this:
- A significant part of this pr now seems to be working around the rank chevron being bogus while paradropping.  This is the fault of the rank code itself (which uses an IEffect instead of the now-standard With\* traits), and should be fixed properly (in its own pr, please!) instead of inserting workarounds in N different parts of the code.
- The `UpgradedVariantWatcher` stuff in our core production trait really doesn't sit well with me.  I'm sure there is a more elegant way this could be done.
I'll get to the `Rank` effect a bit later, but I've moved the icon changing from `ProductionQueue` to a new trait that needs to be attached to the player actor. Is this better?
Rebased.
@matija-hustic: the *Init classes are used by reflection (they bridge to the actor properties defined in map.yaml), so don't believe your editor saying that it isn't used.
Needs a rebase again.
Rebased.
Looks good to me and the testcase worked ingame. :+1: / :white_check_mark:
The production palette widgets now interact with the `UpgradesIcons` trait to see if an upgraded icon should be used.

I was thinking - and you might hate me now - but instead of going with a per-actor cameo switch, why don't you just make an additional layer and put it above the cameo (like how the clock is applied)?

Well, @GraionDilach, RA2 has separate cameos, as @Phrohdoh linked in #7585

See [RA2 icons](http://xhp.xwis.net/ra2_icons/)

That's why I've done it this way.

If everyone agrees that a simple overlay would be better, I'll work on it.
That sounds like a good idea to me.  It means that the veterancy-granting code should be nicely contained within the production queue trait and the build palette widget.

We already did similar changes in RA and the TD mod, such an alteration seems acceptable to me. Not to mention, many of the RA2 units used beta variants of the cameos for upgraded (Crazy Ivan), was missing (Harrier, defences, navy can also gain veterancy in your logic, this was impossible even in Ares-enhanced YR), or went bogus (Cosmonaut to Laser Rocketeer).

This would also let anyone incorporate this trait into any mod without much work.
The upgraded icons are now implemented through overlays.
Fixed as commented.
Works as promised. :white_check_mark: Almost done here.

Fixed as commented. Rebased.

@GraionDilach, may I ask for your help with the cameo overlay please? It doesn't scale nicely and I'm not sure I've converted it correctly.
Okay, I'll do.
